In this episode, a16z Cofounder Ben Horowitz and General Partner Erik Torenberg sit down with Sam to discuss the core thesis behind OpenAI‚Äôs disparate bets, why they released Sora, how they use models internally, the best AI evals, and where we‚Äôre going from here.

News üì∞Ô∏è
1.)
Top 5 Most Clicked News Articles From Last Week
A.)
Sora Is More Powerful Than You Thought
| Theoretically Media | YouTube.com | October 2, 2025
Open AI‚Äôs Sora 2 is examined through a lens that blends playful and practical applications, revealing its capabilities beyond surface-level memes. Key features such as cameo integration and storytelling enhancements are scrutinized to illustrate how Sora is edging closer to professional cinematic production.
B.)
Intro To Agent Builder
| OpenAI | YouTube.com | October 6, 2025
Christina Huang from OpenAI introduces Agent Builder, showcasing its user-friendly visual interface for creating dynamic agentic workflows. With features like drag-and-drop nodes and easy tool connections, users can efficiently publish workflows using ChatKit and the Agents SDK.
C.)
Apps In ChatGPT
| OpenAI | YouTube.com | October 6, 2025
The integration of apps into ChatGPT signifies a new era of interaction, allowing users to engage seamlessly with various applications. With rollout support for Free, Go, Plus, and Pro users outside the EU, further partnerships and capabilities are set to enhance user experience in the coming weeks.
D.)
MrBeast Says AI Could Threaten Creators‚Äô Livelihoods, Calling It ‚ÄòScary Times‚Äô For The Industry
| TechCrunch.com | October 6, 2025
Top YouTube creator MrBeast expresses concern over AI‚Äôs impact on the livelihoods of content creators, questioning how AI-generated videos could affect those making a living from traditional content creation. His apprehension comes after the launch of OpenAI‚Äôs new audio and video generator, raising fears among creators about the future competition from AI technologies.
E.)
OpenAI Launches AgentKit With New Tools For Building, Deploying, And Optimizing AI Agents
| OpenAI.com | October 6, 2025
Today we‚Äôre launching AgentKit, a complete set of tools for developers and enterprises to build, deploy, and optimize agents. Until now, building agents meant juggling fragmented tools, complex orchestration with no versioning, custom connectors, manual eval pipelines, prompt tuning, and weeks of frontend work before launch. With AgentKit, developers can now design workflows visually and embed agentic UIs faster using new building blocks.
October 14, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è

4.)
Do You Have A Link In This Issue? Learn How To Track It For Free
| AI-Weekly.ai | October 14, 2025
This article outlines, step-by-step, how you can get free website traffic reporting on any link to your domain (AKA domain name, website or web address) that has been published by AI-Weekly.
October 13, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
5.)
How Data Centers Are Changing The World
| Matt Berman | YouTube.com | October 13, 2025
Explore the transformative role of data centers in our digital landscape, shedding light on their operational mechanics, energy consumption, and critical importance in cloud computing. Gain insights into their design, geographical considerations, and the myths surrounding their impact on technology and society.
6.)
OpenAI X Broadcom ‚Äî The OpenAI Podcast Ep. 8
| OpenAI | YouTube.com | October 13, 2025
OpenAI‚Äôs partnership with Broadcom aims to revolutionize AI infrastructure by developing custom chips informed by insights from cutting-edge AI model development. Sam Altman and Greg Brockman join Hock Tan and Charlie Kawwas to explore innovative pathways in computing and the future possibilities of artificial intelligence.
7.)
Will LLMs Get Us To AGI?
| A16Z | YouTube.com | October 13, 2025
Vishal Misra, a renowned computer science professor at Columbia, explores the potential of large language models (LLMs) to drive scientific breakthroughs and their limitations in achieving true artificial general intelligence (AGI). The conversation delves into the mechanics of reasoning, the impact of entropy on prediction, and the defining attributes of AGI.
8.)
Agile AI Architectures: A Fungible Data Center For The Intelligent Era
| Cloud.google.com | October 13, 2025
As AI technology accelerates, the need for adaptable data center architectures that support dynamic growth and diverse requirements becomes crucial. This article emphasizes the importance of designing data centers with fungibility and agility, allowing for modular and interoperable systems that can easily adapt to changing demands.
9.)
Slack Upgrades Slackbot With New AI Assistant Features For Enhanced Productivity And User Support
| TheVerge.com | October 13, 2025
The revamped Slackbot acts more like an AI companion that can help you create plans, schedule meetings, find files, and more.
10.)
Google Supports New California Law Introducing Internet Age-Gating For Online Platforms And Services
| TheVerge.com | October 13, 2025
California joins a growing group of states with a new internet age-gating law after Gov. Gavin Newsom (D) signed AB 1043, the Digital Age Assurance Act.
11.)
California Strengthens Online Child Protection With New Bills Signed By Governor Newsom
| Gov.ca.gov | October 13, 2025
Governor Newsom signed legislation to further protect children online and address emerging threats as technology continues to develop ‚Äî maintaining the state‚Äôs position as a national leader in both safeguarding kids and encouraging innovation.
12.)
Microsoft AI Launches Mai-Image-1, Debuting In Top 10 On LMArena Leaderboard
| Microsoft.ai | October 13, 2025
Today, we‚Äôre announcing MAI-Image-1, our first image generation model developed entirely in-house, debuting in the top 10 text-to-image models on LMArena.
13.)
Google Upgrades Notebooklm Video Overviews With Nano Banana Visuals And New Quick Brief Summaries
| Blog.google | October 13, 2025
Video Overviews now look even better thanks to Nano Banana, Gemini‚Äôs latest image generation update. Plus, try a new ‚ÄúBrief‚Äù format for quick insights.
14.)
Google Brings Nano Banana AI Image Editing To Search, Notebooklm, And Photos
| Blog.google | October 13, 2025
In August, we introduced our latest image editing model, Nano Banana from Gemini 2.5 Flash. And since then, we‚Äôve seen many of the unique and creative ways people have put it to use in the Gemini app, with more than 5 billion images generated to date.
15.)
Google Adds New AI-Powered Features To Search And Discover For Better Web Content Connection
| Blog.google | October 13, 2025
We‚Äôre introducing two new AI-powered features in Search and Discover to help you connect with fresh content and links from across the web.
16.)
OpenAI And Broadcom Partner To Deploy 10gw Of AI Accelerators For Next-Gen AI Clusters
| OpenAI.com | October 13, 2025
Multi-year partnership enables OpenAI and Broadcom to deliver accelerator and network systems for next-generation AI clusters.
17.)
AI Could Make It Harder To Establish Blame For Medical Failings, Experts Say
| TheGuardian.com | October 13, 2025
The rising use of artificial intelligence in healthcare raises concerns about establishing liability for medical failures. Experts highlight issues such as lack of testing and complex legal challenges for patients seeking to prove fault when AI systems are involved in negative outcomes.
18.)
Deloitte And Oracle Announce Integration To Help Organizations Deploy Agentic AI
| Pymnts.com | October 13, 2025
Deloitte has integrated its Zora AI with Oracle Fusion Cloud to help organizations automate complex business processes through agentic artificial intelligence. This partnership aims to eliminate data siloes and enhance productivity by creating multi-agent teams capable of optimizing operations and predicting disruptions.
19.)
How To Edit Images With Nano Banana In Search
| Blog.google | October 13, 2025
Google is rolling out a new image editing model called Nano Banana, allowing users to transform photos through Lens and AI Mode. This feature, available in the Google app, enables users to create, edit, and share images easily with suggested prompts and the option to use existing images.
20.)
Introducing LLM-Evalkit: A Practical Framework For Prompt Engineering On Google Cloud
| Cloud.google.com | October 13, 2025
LLM-Evalkit is a lightweight, open-source application that centralizes and streamlines prompt engineering on Google Cloud. By unifying disparate workflows, it allows teams to track metrics and iterate on prompts effectively, democratizing the process with a no-code interface for broader team participation.
21.)
Microsoft AI Announces First Image Generator Created In-House
| TheVerge.com | October 13, 2025
Microsoft has unveiled its first in-house text-to-image generator, MAI-Image-1, designed for high-quality photorealistic imagery. The model has already ranked in the top 10 on LMArena, showcasing its rapid performance and efficiency based on feedback from creative professionals.
22.)
Nano Banana Is Coming To Google Search, NotebookLM And Photos
| Blog.google | October 13, 2025
Google is expanding its image editing model, Nano Banana, to Search and NotebookLM, with plans to include Photos soon. Users will be able to enhance images using AI through the Lens feature in Search and benefit from new illustration styles in NotebookLM.
23.)
New California Law Requires AI To Tell You It‚Äôs AI
| TheVerge.com | October 13, 2025
California has enacted Senate Bill 243, which mandates that AI chatbot developers disclose when users are interacting with AI rather than a human. The law aims to enhance online safety, especially for children, by instituting safeguards around companion chatbot interactions.
24.)
Video Overviews On NotebookLM Get A Major Upgrade With Nano Banana
| Blog.google | October 13, 2025
NotebookLM‚Äôs Video Overviews feature has received a significant upgrade utilizing Gemini‚Äôs image generation model, Nano Banana. This update enhances the visual presentation of videos created from documents.
25.)
NVIDIA, Partners Drive Next-Gen Efficient Gigawatt AI Factories In Buildup For Vera Rubin
| Blogs.nvidia.com | October 13, 2025
NVIDIA and its partners are preparing for the deployment of gigawatt AI factories with innovative 800 VDC data centers. The new NVIDIA Vera Rubin NVL144 MGX rack servers are designed to support advanced AI workloads, featuring liquid cooling and energy-efficient architecture, while over 50 ecosystem partners are contributing technology tailored for these next-generation facilities.
26.)
OpenAI And Broadcom Announce Strategic Collaboration To Deploy 10 Gigawatts Of OpenAI-Designed AI Accelerators
| OpenAI.com | October 13, 2025
OpenAI and Broadcom have initiated a multi-year partnership to develop and deploy 10 gigawatts of AI accelerators. This collaboration aims to meet the global demand for AI through advanced hardware and networking solutions, ultimately enhancing AI capabilities and infrastructure.
27.)
OpenAI Partners With Broadcom To Produce Its Own AI Chips
| TheVerge.com | October 13, 2025
OpenAI has announced a collaboration with Broadcom to design custom chips aimed at enhancing its AI infrastructure, particularly for data centers powering applications like ChatGPT. The deal signifies OpenAI‚Äôs efforts to decrease dependence on Nvidia while developing advanced computational capabilities for AI applications.
28.)
Samsung‚Äôs Impressive Tiny AI Win
| TheNeuronDaily.com | October 13, 2025
Samsung‚Äôs new Tiny Recursive Model (TRM), with only 7 million parameters, achieves superior results in AI reasoning benchmarks compared to larger models, proving that smaller architectures can outperform those built on brute-force scaling. This innovative model demonstrates that recursive reasoning and continuous refinement can lead to effective AI performance.
29.)
Programming In Assembly Is Brutal, Beautiful, And Maybe Even A Path To Better AI
| Wired.com | October 13, 2025
Exploring the intricacies and artistry of programming in assembly language, this article highlights how developers like Chris Sawyer created complex video games while pushing the limits of computer efficiency. The narrative connects historical assembly programming with contemporary AI advancements, demonstrating a resurgence of low-level coding principles in today‚Äôs tech landscape.
30.)
The Next Frontier of Intelligence
| InsideQuantumTechnology.com | October 13, 2025
Nexus Ventures, a prominent sponsor of the upcoming Q+AI event, is actively investing at the intersection of artificial intelligence and quantum computing, aiming to support breakthrough companies. Their analytical approach and strategic investment decisions signal a commitment to advancing technologies positioned for significant future impact.
31.)
Vibe Analytics For Data Insights That Are Simple To Surface
| ArtificialIntelligence-News.com | October 13, 2025
Vibe analytics offers a solution for organizations looking to extract clean insights from complex data without extensive manual work. Using natural language queries, users can obtain real-time insights quickly without writing code, making data analysis more accessible to semitechnical users. The platform is designed for both data experts and everyday business users, ensuring accuracy and transparency.
32.)
‚ÄòGPT-6 Will Be Significantly Better‚Äô: Sam Altman On What Openai Learned From Rocky GPT-5 Launch
| IndianExpress.com | October 13, 2025
OpenAI CEO Sam Altman has expressed confidence that the upcoming GPT-6 will vastly outperform its predecessor, GPT-5, which faced criticism for failing to meet user expectations. He highlighted that improvements would stem from using advanced techniques rather than simply increasing training data and processing power.
October 12, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
33.)
How I Code With AI
| Chris Penn | YouTube.com | October 12, 2025
Unlock the essential strategies for integrating generative AI into coding projects with a comprehensive six-part framework tailored for all experience levels. From planning to execution, learn how to harness AI for high-quality code development while maintaining effective project management.
34.)
Top 15 New Futuristic Innovations You Can‚Äôt Afford to Miss
| AI Uncovered | YouTube.com | October 12, 2025
Revolutionary technologies are emerging, reshaping the way we live, work, and interact with the world. From self-healing materials to AI breakthroughs, these innovations represent the forefront of what is possible and challenge existing paradigms. Discover how these advancements could potentially impact your future and the economy at large.
35.)
Is This The ‚ÄúModel T Moment‚Äù For Robots?
| TheNeuronDaily.com | October 12, 2025
The onset of AI-powered robots is likened to the groundbreaking moment of the Ford Model T, with a focus on mass production. The new Figure 03 robot is designed for home use, capable of tasks like folding laundry and clearing tables, while also relying on advanced AI learning methods and significant financial backing.
36.)
Police Are Asking Kids To Stop Pulling AI Homeless Man Prank
| TheVerge.com | October 12, 2025
A viral prank involving AI-generated images of a homeless man has led to increased anxiety among parents and unnecessary calls to law enforcement, as a number of children send fabricated images to their parents claiming to have let a stranger into their home. Police warn that this prank can result in serious consequences, including SWAT responses, as it misleads authorities who may treat the situation as a genuine emergency.
October 11, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
37.)
Bitter-Sweethearts: An Astonishing Proportion Of High Schoolers Have Had A ‚ÄúRomantic Relationship‚Äù With An AI, Research Finds
| Futurism.com | October 11, 2025
A recent survey reveals that 19% of high school students in the US have engaged in a romantic relationship with AI, highlighted by the rapid integration of AI tools in educational settings. The alarming use of AI for personal comfort and mental health support among teens raises concerns about its impact on their relationships and emotional well-being.
38.)
Being Rude To ChatGPT Gets More Accurate Answers Than Politeness, Finds Research
| DigitalTrends.com | October 11, 2025
A recent study indicates that the tone used when interacting with AI, such as ChatGPT, influences response accuracy. Queries phrased rudely resulted in higher accuracy compared to more polite inquiries, suggesting that tone may significantly affect AI performance.
39.)
Using A Swearword In Your Google Search Can Stop The AI Answer. But Should You?
| TheGuardian.com | October 11, 2025
The article explores how users can hinder AI responses in search engines by using profanity. It discusses the growing integration of AI in various sectors, the challenges people face in avoiding it, and the implications of relying on AI tools in everyday situations.
40.)
It‚Äôs Not Too Late For Apple To Get AI Right
| TechCrunch.com | October 11, 2025
Apple faces competition from OpenAI‚Äôs new app platform, which could threaten its App Store dominance. Despite delays in Siri‚Äôs AI enhancements, Apple‚Äôs integration of AI features may still provide it an edge by reinventing how users interact with apps, promoting a future beyond traditional app icons.
October 10, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
41.)
ChatGPT Takes A HUGE Step Forward & More AI Use Cases
| The AI Advantage | YouTube.com | October 10, 2025
Igor highlights key updates from OpenAI‚Äôs DevDay 2025, including new Apps in ChatGPT and Agent tools for developers. The session also features a demonstration of the latest text-to-image model and insights into Google‚Äôs Gemini Computer Use Model, wrapped up with brief updates on various AI advancements.
42.)
OpenAI Nerfs Sora 2. Chaos Still Reigns. Is It Over??
| AI For Humans | YouTube.com | October 10, 2025
OpenAI faces backlash as Sora 2 experiences significant restrictions under Sam Altman‚Äôs leadership. Industry figures like Mark Cuban and Jake Paul take advantage of new AI tools, while discussions around IP rights and creative content ignites frustration among Hollywood influencers.
43.)
SEO Mark Williams-Cook on AI vs Google Search‚Ä¶.Behind the Scenes
| The Neuron | YouTube.com | October 10, 2025
Mark Williams-Cook delves into the impacts of AI on search engine optimization, exposing the ‚Äúleaky bucket‚Äù issue that traditional search faces. With illuminating examples and critical insights, he challenges the effectiveness of new AI models in improving search reliability and underscores the emerging significance of platforms like Reddit in digital marketing.
44.)
How to Automate Viral TikTok Videos
| Matt Wolfe | YouTube.com | October 10, 2025
Matt Wolfe takes viewers on a journey to create viral TikTok science explainer videos using AI tools, from generating lyrics with ChatGPT to automating visuals with various platforms. The endeavor highlights both the potential and challenges of harnessing artificial intelligence for creative content, illustrating the unpredictable nature of going viral.
45.)
This Tiny Model Is Insane‚Ä¶ (7M Parameters)
| Matt Berman | YouTube.com | October 10, 2025
Explore the groundbreaking innovations in AI as this tiny model, featuring 7 million parameters, showcases impressive capabilities. Delve into its potential applications and the advancements that bring us closer to a smarter future.
46.)
Hollywood Has No Idea What To Do About AI
| TheVerge.com | October 10, 2025
OpenAI‚Äôs new Sora app, launched at the OpenAI DevDay, emphasizes the tension between Silicon Valley and Hollywood regarding AI‚Äôs implications. While industry leaders express concern over copyright issues, many in Hollywood are unprepared for AI‚Äôs rapid advancements and how they will manage the risks involved, leaving them vulnerable to technological upheavals.
47.)
OpenAI Allegedly Sent Police To An AI Regulation Advocate‚Äôs Door
| TheVerge.com | October 10, 2025
OpenAI has reportedly issued subpoenas to Nathan Calvin, an AI regulation advocate, demanding documents and communications regarding his interactions with California legislators. Calvin claims this move was intended to intimidate critics amidst ongoing legal battles involving Elon Musk and OpenAI‚Äôs regulatory efforts.
48.)
OpenAI Is Trying To Clamp Down On ‚ÄòBias‚Äô In ChatGPT
| TheVerge.com | October 10, 2025
OpenAI claims its latest GPT-5 models are the least biased yet, following rigorous testing against politically charged prompts. The evaluation aimed to ensure responses maintain neutrality, particularly on contentious issues like immigration and abortion, amid ongoing criticism regarding bias in AIs.
49.)
Maybe It‚Äôs Real, Maybe It‚Äôs Sora
| TheVerge.com | October 10, 2025
The Vergecast episode covers OpenAI‚Äôs latest developments, including new applications for ChatGPT and its upcoming social network Sora. The hosts discuss the implications of these advancements and the mixed reception of Sora amid its novel features.
50.)
The Guardian View On An AI Bubble: Capitalism Still Hasn‚Äôt Evolved To Protect Itself
| TheGuardian.com | October 10, 2025
The article addresses concerns regarding the AI boom driving tech stock valuations to potentially unsustainable levels reminiscent of the dot-com bubble. It highlights warnings from financial regulators and prominent figures in the tech industry, calling for institutional redesign to manage risk and safeguard society against financial crises.
51.)
So AI Can Be Poisoned Like, Really Easily
| TheNeuronDaily.com | October 10, 2025
A recent study reveals that only 250 poisoned documents are sufficient to backdoor AI models, highlighting a critical vulnerability in AI security. This finding suggests that AI‚Äôs reliance on extensive training data doesn‚Äôt necessarily correlate with safety, which calls for urgent improvements in current defensive measures.
October 9, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
52.)
Top 15 New Inventions That‚Äôll Make You Feel Like You‚Äôre in 2040
| AI Uncovered | YouTube.com | October 9, 2025
Experience groundbreaking developments that blur the line between the present and the future. From cutting-edge AI technology to revolutionary medical advancements, these 15 inventions promise to reshape everyday life and bring us closer to a world envisioned in the future. Explore how these innovations are set to impact our daily existence and that of generations to come.
53.)
What Work Looks Like With ChatGPT | Write, Research, Code, Create
| OpenAI | YouTube.com | October 9, 2025
ChatGPT is revolutionizing workplace efficiency by enabling teams to transform ideas into action swiftly. With capabilities in data analysis, coding, and research, organizations are enhancing collaboration while maintaining data privacy and security.
54.)
Building With MCP And The Claude API
| Anthropic | YouTube.com | October 9, 2025
Anthropic‚Äôs Alex Albert, John Welsh, and Michael Cohen delve into the Model Context Protocol (MCP) and its significance in enhancing AI applications through seamless integration with external systems. The discussion highlights MCP‚Äôs origins, open-sourcing efforts, best practices for implementation, and the promising future of this ecosystem.
55.)
The Secret To Getting 10x More Relevant Results In ChatGPT
| The AI Advantage | YouTube.com | October 9, 2025
Igor reveals advanced customization techniques for ChatGPT that enhance user experience across both free and paid plans. Viewers will learn how to effectively leverage personalization options to achieve significantly improved results tailored to their specific needs.
56.)
Massive AI Upscale Breakthrough!
| Theoretically Media | YouTube.com | October 9, 2025
An intriguing exploration of the latest advancements in AI video technology featuring groundbreaking updates from Grok and Luma Labs. Highlighting challenges in AI image enhancement, this presentation also unveils a significant new feature aimed at improving character face preservation while enhancing video quality.
57.)
Americans Just Voted: 58% Of Jobs Should Go To AI
| TheNeuronDaily.com | October 9, 2025
A recent survey shows that 58% of Americans favor automating jobs with AI, specifically supporting full automation for 30% of occupations. However, about 12% of jobs, including caregiving and therapy, are deemed morally repugnant to automate, suggesting that societal values should guide automation decisions.
58.)
Meta Adds Hindi-English Translation, Dubbing, And Lip Sync For Reels On Instagram And Facebook
| About.fb.com | October 9, 2025
Imagine discovering a reel that makes you laugh, inspires you, or teaches you something new, no matter where it was created or what language it was filmed in. That‚Äôs the future we‚Äôre building at Meta.
59.)
Anthropic Finds Even Small Data Samples Can Poison Large Language Models Of Any Size
| Anthropic.com | October 9, 2025
In a joint study with the UK AI Security Institute and the Alan Turing Institute, we found that as few as 250 malicious documents can produce a ‚Äúbackdoor‚Äù vulnerability in a large language model, regardless of model size or training data volume. Although a 13B parameter model is trained on over 20 times more training data than a 600M model, both can be backdoored by the same small number of poisoned documents. Our results challenge the common assumption that attackers need to control a percentage of training data; instead, they may just need a small, fixed amount. Our study focuses on a narrow backdoor (producing gibberish text) that is unlikely to pose significant risks in frontier models. Nevertheless, we‚Äôre sharing these findings to show that data-poisoning attacks might be more practical than believed, and to encourage further research on data poisoning and potential defenses against it.
60.)
Anthropic Launches Plugins For Claude Code, Enabling Custom Slash Commands, Agents, And Integrations
| Anthropic.com | October 9, 2025
Claude Code now supports plugins: custom collections of slash commands, agents, MCP servers, and hooks that install with a single command.
61.)
OpenAI Introduces New Methods To Evaluate And Reduce Political Bias In ChatGPT
| OpenAI.com | October 9, 2025
ChatGPT shouldn‚Äôt have political bias in any direction. People use ChatGPT as a tool to learn and explore ideas. That only works if they trust ChatGPT to be objective. We outline our commitment to keeping ChatGPT objective by default, with the user in control, in our Model Spec principle Seeking the Truth Together.
October 8, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
62.)
By Far The Fastest Way To Build Apps With AI
| The AI Advantage | YouTube.com | October 8, 2025
Igor showcases an efficient method for rapidly developing functional applications with AI support. Following a detailed step-by-step guide, he reveals how he created an app for personal use with Base44, empowering viewers to replicate his process easily.
63.)
Greg Brockman: AGI, Sora 2, Bottlenecks, White Collar, Proactive AI, and More!
| Matt Berman | YouTube.com | October 8, 2025
Greg Brockman delves into the future of artificial general intelligence, examining key innovations such as Sora 2, and the implications for the workforce. He emphasizes the significance of overcoming technological bottlenecks and the evolution of proactive AI in shaping tomorrow‚Äôs economy.
64.)
Sam Altman On Sora, Energy, And Building An AI Empire
| A16Z | YouTube.com | October 8, 2025
Sam Altman joins a16z‚Äôs Ben Horowitz and Erik Torenberg for an insightful conversation on OpenAI‚Äôs ambitious strategies and the launch of Sora. The discussion covers critical topics such as AI evaluation, internal model applications, and the intersection of policy and technology in shaping the future of AI.
65.)
Google‚Äôs New AI Actually Controls Your Computer
| TheNeuronDaily.com | October 8, 2025
Google has launched Gemini 2.5, an AI model that controls computer tasks with notable efficiency, outperforming competitors like Claude and OpenAI in several benchmarks. This model is already being integrated internally to streamline tasks and increase productivity, enabling automations like form filling and complex web navigation.
66.)
Qualcomm Acquires Arduino To Accelerate Developer Access To AI Solutions
| BetaNews.com | October 8, 2025
Chipmaker Qualcomm has announced that it is acquiring Arduino. Best known for its Arduino boards, the Italian firm is getting a new owner for an undisclosed sum of money.
67.)
Google Expands Virtual Try-On Tool To Shoes And Launches In Australia, Canada, And Japan Soon
| Blog.google | October 8, 2025
Google‚Äôs try on tech lets you see what billions of clothing items might look like on you. 1 In the coming weeks it‚Äôs expanding to Australia, Canada and Japan, and starting today it‚Äôs rolling out to a new category ‚Äî shoes.
68.)
Google Launches Gemini CLI Extensions To Customize Workflows And Integrate With Your Favorite Tools
| Blog.google | October 8, 2025
With extensions, you can connect the power of Gemini to your everyday workflows and the tools you use most, making Gemini CLI uniquely yours.
October 7, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
69.)
How to Create Cinematic AI Videos (No-BS Guide)
| Jeff Su | YouTube.com | October 7, 2025
Jeff provides a straightforward 4-step workflow for creating multi-scene AI videos, emphasizing the importance of consistency in characters, voices, and scenes.
